text: It's 1967, the Summer of Love and -- BOOM! Entry doors swing open as PARAMEDICS wheel in a FEM VANESSA (20s, black, nine months pregnant). She's deathly spewing founts of blood from a savagely slashed throat -- A SHOCK-TRAUMA TEAM swarms over her, inserting a vacutain artery to draw blood, wrapping a blood pressure cuff arou arm --
(with stethoscope)
She's not breathing!
Intubate her! The RESPIRATORY THERAPIST feeds an endotracheal tube down ruined throat, attaches that to an Amblu bag --
Blood-pressure's forty and falling -- The woman starts spasming violently. It takes three staff just to hold her down.
Jesus, her water's broken -- (calling for help)
She's going into uterine contractions -- CAMERA PUSHES IN on the woman as she bolts upright, SCREA the dead. We PLUNGE INTO the darkness of her mouth and fi ourselves --
The sound of a HEART BEATING, pounding as we whip-snake t
floating in amber plasma. Erythrocytes, leukocytes, neutr eosinophils.  The rhythmic expansion of the artery walls, pulsing with successive surge of blood as the HEART BEATS FASTER AND F taking us --

A CHILD, alive but unborn, shifting in a sea of amniotic surrounded by the white, protective substance known as ve caseosa. The HEARTBEAT races like a locomotive now. The u shifts, turns its head towards us -- -- and opens its eyes.
cleaving the darkness, radiant light slicing across gleam steel. Words acid-etched in the weapon's fine-tempered su
Main credits end.

A decaying no man's land populated by condemned buildings HOMELESS. Steam rises from manhole covers, drifting acros litter- lined streets. Suddenly -- A black Mercedes 850 appears over the crest of a hill, RO us, stereo system belting out FILTER.

Raquel, a wasp-wasted woman, sits behind the wheel. 20s, sickeningly attractive. Hungry eyes.  Squirming around in the passenger seat is DENNIS, a model toy with a sub-zero IQ and a "fuck me sideways" grin.
So where we going?
It's a surprise.
I likes surprises.  Raquel eyeballs Dennis -- "if looks could devour".
What do you have down there, little  man?
Heat-seeker.
I'll bet. Raquel slides a manicured hand up his thigh, squeezes his Dennis MOANS. She pulls her hand away, downshifts.
The 850 threads a narrow alley into a vacant lot, BRAKES and Dennis climb out. She leads him into --
Industry never sleeps, and certainly not this grisly faci leads Dennis around the back of the plant, where a host o are loading refrigerated trucks with product.
What the fuck are we doing here? Raquel just smiles, heads on into the plant via a loading workers ignore her.

Dennis follows Raquel through the bowels of the plant, ca glimpses here and there of carcasses being rendered or ha Through one partially open door we see what might be a li BODYBAGS being trundled into the back of a truck via a ho pulley-system. But Dennis doesn't have enough time to be the vision, because he's being pulled away by Raquel, led

We are in the basement now. At the end of the hall is a s with perhaps, just the faintest HINT OF MUSIC heard comin beyond. Raquel knocks. A "peep-hole" slat opens and a BLACK LIGHT shines into Ra A VOICE behind the door offers a verbal challenge, speaki language we've never heard, laced with a devilish cadence Raquel responds in kind. The door opens. Raquel gives Den knowing wink, enters. Dennis follows.
Raquel and Dennis move past a hulking DOORMAN, making the a narrow stairway. Dennis is suitably impressed.
is elite, underground -- an "abattoir-chic" version of an juke joint with a greasy, dangerous vibe. White-tiled wal floors for easy hosing, chromed fittings, run-off gutters bar.

writhe on the strobe-lit dance floor. A heavy S&M scene. Latex. Tattoos. Body-piercings. A D.J. wearing head-mounted spotlights orchestrates the t twin- decks. MUSIC assaults us -- a beat so heavy it coul fillings from your teeth. Brutal "DARKCORE" along the lin Prodigy or Underground.  Raquel pulls Dennis out onto the dance floor. They sway.  A lupine-featured GAULTIER GIRL with a streak of white ru through her raven hair moves in behind Dennis, pressing u him. Rachel Williams as the Angel of Death -- we'll call Mercury flicks her tongue against Dennis' ear -- it's bee with a silver post which clicks against her teeth. Tattoo her back in black is a swirling, tribal vortex.  Dennis is now sandwiched between Raquel and Mercury, the them dry-humping their way to every man's glory.  The beat gets LOUDER. The action heavier. The atmosphere narcotic. People are stripping off their clothes, sweatin fiends. It's a virtual orgy. Dennis laughs, reveling in the hedonism. Everything rises pitch --
(over the music)

Fuck, I need a drink!!! Raquel just smiles -- then Dennis notices a DROP OF SOMET his hand. It looks like blood. Dennis looks up, concerned -- MORE BLOOD DROPLETS are falling. Raquel's face is spri them now. Dennis stops dancing. What is this? Some kind o performance art? Raquel turns her face toward the ceiling, as if washing h summer shower, now the other club goers are looking up to
from sprinkler heads in the ceiling, drenching the dancer goers love it, thrusting their heads back, mouths open wi receive the crimson offering.  Horrified, Dennis recoils, turning towards --

whose face morphs into a preternatural snarl. Her canines tapering to razor-sharp points. Her tongue flicks, lizard fingernails sharpen into claws. All this while the whites BLEED RED, pupils oscillating hypnotically.

What's wrong, baby? Dennis SCREAMS, pushes away from Raquel, only -- -- Mercury has fangs now too. In fact, everyone in the cl with the exception of poor Dennis. That's because they're vampires. Dennis tries to run, but the burly Doorman blocks his exi smashing his fist into Dennis' face.  Dennis falls, dazed. The club-goers close in around him. game of it, shoving him from one person to another, their leering like twisted jack-o-lanterns. The strobe lights quicken to a seizure-inducing intensity spins, tumbling into Raquel's arms. She shoves him forwar lands on the floor, falling at someone's boot-clad feet. A DARK FIGURE sits in the shadows, unnoticed until this m figure stands, moves into the light as time screeches to

towers above Dennis, wearing dark glasses and a leather l sneer of cruel contempt etched upon a face tempered by a horror. His name is BLADE. Blade whips open his long coat, shrugging it off, reveali arsenal of high-tech weapons strapped to his body:  6-point adjustable body armor, a modified CAR-15 assault an ultra-violet entry light, two Casull .454 revolvers, a automatic cross-bow, a bandoleer of mahogany stakes, an I katar punching dagger -- and last, but certainly not leas namesake -- a silver sword which is secured in a back-sca

A gaze as cold and pitiless as a midnight sun. The vampir stare back. Nuclear silence. And then -- All hell breaks loose. With a SNARL, Raquel charges at Bl at superhuman speed, practically a blur --  Blade draws his Casulls, FIRES in multiple directions --

as a round roars through the air towards Raquel. A silver dum bullet which explodes on contact. WHAM! The round punches a fist-sized hole through Raquel' continuing on into the vamp behind her! Vampire blood fou creatures tumble forward, their bodies liquefying into pu black oil which go gurgling down the run-off drains. Blade continues FIRING, then -CLICK!- magazines empty. Ne holsters the Casulls, swings up his assault rifle, calmly the UV entry light mounted above --

leaps twenty feet straight up into the air. We've never s move so fast. She CRASHES through a glass skylight, disap the night just as -- -- a shaft of blinding UV "sunlight" cuts across the vamp rear back, skin smoking from the light's corrosive effect opens FIRE, pumping round after round of wooden fragmenta into the crowd -- vampire genocide. The strobe lights flicker as the mayhem mounts. Some of t try to flee, scurrying up the stairs, but the exit quickl clogged with liquefying bodies --  -- then Blade's CAR-15 jams. The remaining club-goers see opening, surge forward en masse --  Blade drops the rifle, reaches over his shoulder and -SCH unsheathes his sword with a double-handed grip.

Four acid-etched feet of blood-soaked Damascus steel. An sharp it could cleave a shadow in two. Blade moves like lightning, hacking his way into TWO CHAR VAMPIRES. Blade spins again, cuts ANOTHER VAMPIRE clean i

text: a LATEX-CLAD VAMP makes a break for it. Blade flings his sending it spinning end over end -- THUNK! The sword punc vampire's heart. The hellish creature convulses, dies. Beat. Blade retrieves his sword, then senses --

rising up behind him. In a flash, Blade swings his sword cutting off the vampire's right hand at the elbow. The se falls to the floor --  -- but it doesn't slow the hulking creature down. It SLAM Blade. Blade flies backwards thirty feet, tumbling over t slamming into the rear wall so hard that plaster rains do ceiling.  Blade suddenly finds himself wrestling with a feral-faced something nightmare named QUINN. The vampire rears back i jaws stretching wide. Every inch of his face is covered w scarification patterns and Maori-like tribal tattoos.  Blade forces an elbow against Quinn's throat, trying to k bay. With his other hand he reaches to his bandoleer, pul stake -- CRUNCH! Blade shoves the stake through the vampi Quinn gurgles, clutches at his throat.  Blade rolls out from under, unholsters the cross-bow secu leg. With a flick of a switch the arms of the bow -SNAP!- drawing the bow-string taut. Blade FIRES --  The bolt hits Quinn in the shoulder, throwing him backwar nailing him to the wall. As Quinn reaches over with his o pull out the stake -- Blade FIRES AGAIN. A second bolt slams into Quinn's other effectively pinning him like a butterfly to a board.
mounted in one of the corners, is a security camera. Blad cross-bow bolt straight into the lens.  Blade strides over, placing his sword against Quinn's che
Where is Deacon Frost? Quinn glares, trying to speak, gagging on the stake still his trachea --
Got something in your throat. Blade yanks the stake free. The vampire laughs, air whist his ruined larynx.
Fuck you, Day-walker, I ain't saying  shit --
Frost. Quinn responds with a slew of rapid-fire vampire invectiv sees he's getting nowhere fast, calmly sheathes his sword a white phosphorous grenade from his combat harness --

You won't stop him, Blade. The Tide's  rising, the Sleeper's gonna -- Blade shoves the grenade in Quinn's mouth, pulls the pin. Quinn goes up like a roman candle. Blade turns, surveying ignoring the howling pyre behind him: All evidence of the vampires is gone -- with the exceptio oily-black puddles. Clothes, jewelry -- it's all been bur the acidic process of the creatures' accelerated decompos DENNIS sits huddled in a corner, having pissed his pants. approaches, he cringes back --

Please don't -- Blade simply grabs Dennis by the jaw, tilting his head up rotating it from side to side -- looking for bite marks. any. Blade moves on, leaving Dennis alone amidst the carnage. starts up the stairs, he pauses in mid-step --
scurries out from underfoot.  Blade adjusts his footfall, sparing the roach. He continu stairs, disappearing in the smoky haze.
CAMERA FOLLOWS a bagged corpse as it's rolled into the au by an ASSISTANT.

Brought you a baked potato, nice and crispy. Still warm, too. CURTIS WEBB, the forensic pathologist (30s, white bread, the smarmy side) steps forward, unzips the bag -- It's Quinn, what's left of him, anyway. Burnt to a charco briquette, limbs twisted horribly, oozing fluids. Curtis turns his head, grimacing, wafting the air.
Jesus, that's rank --  Curtis turns back, makes note of the blackened stump wher arm used to be, the ruined throat --
What's his story?
Paramedics said he was still screaming  when they found him. Looks like some  joker had stapled him to a wall.
Pretty.

of a slide-mounted blood smear stained with Wright stain What we see is a collection of donut-shaped pink things ( cells) intermingled with some small blue specks (platelet occasional larger, light-blue blobs (white blood cells). KAREN JANSEN (20s), a fine-featured hematologist with a s in suspended animation, sits back from the microscope, st to her is JULIE WHITAKER, a cheerful chemtech.
You took this off a DOA? Curtis sits on a stool nearby, slowly nodding.
This isn't human blood.
Then what is it?
I don't know -- (re: microscope)
Look at this blood smear --  Curtis takes a look for himself.
The red blood cells are biconvex,  which is theoretically impossible.  They're hypochromic, there's virtually  no hemoglobin in them.  (shaking her head)
Look at the PMNs, they're binucleated,  they should be mononucleated.
What about the chemistry panel?  Karen looks to Julie, who reaches for a computer print-ou
Blood sugar level is three times the  norm, phosphorous and uric acid are  off the scales. (shrugs)
Like the woman said, impossible. Karen removes her glasses, rubbing the bridge of her nose
Curtis, it's three in the morning. I'm  really not in the mood for one of your  practical jokes.
(insistent)
It's not a joke. I've got the stiff  sitting in the morgue right now --  look, just come up and see him, okay?  Five minutes, that's all I ask.
I thought you promised to give me some  distance?
This is purely professional curiosity,  Karen, I swear. Karen rolls her eyes, lets loose a tired sigh.
Five minutes, not a second more. And I  don't want to hear a word about "us".
No problem.
The dead of night, not a mouse in the house. Curtis and K garbed in a mask, stand on either side of Quinn's body, w rests on the autopsy table.
A preliminary exploratory Y-incision has been made across stretching from shoulder to shoulder, then continuing on abdomen. Ribs and cartilage have been cut open to expose and lungs.
You haven't started in on the internal  organs?
Just the blood sample from the  pericardial sac. Curtis pauses, studying Quinn's disfigured face -- the fe much less damaged now -- almost as if the corpse were hea
That's weird --
What?
He looks different now, burns are less  extreme, some of these wounds have  closed up --  Curtis pulls out a penlight, flicks it on. He leans over shining the light into one of his eyes.
Tell me something, honestly, you ever  have second thoughts about us?
(grudgingly)
Sometimes -- Curtis looks up from the corpse, grinning beneath his mas
-- but then I remember what an  ass-hole you were and I'm snapped back  to reality.

Jesus, Karen, you're breaking my heart  here -- Quinn suddenly bolts up from the autopsy table, sinking h into Curtis' jugular. He snaps the man's neck in two for access, sucking in blood like a living vacuum.  Karen stumbles backwards, sending autopsy tools CLATTERIN
rises from the table, flinging Curtis' twitching body asi his blood-soaked lips back, baring viper-like fangs, emit
(crazed by thirst)

-- more -- blood -- Karen backs into the corpse drawers, but Quinn is upon he second, wrapping a hand about her throat. His mouth opens disturbingly wide as if to swallow her head whole, causti dripping from his canines --  Karen tries to turn her head away, but Quinn's grip is vi finds herself staring into his eyes -- pupils pulsing rap opening and closing, hypnotic -- As Quinn sinks the tips of his fangs into Karen's carotid starts to nurse -- BANG!!! A load of MAHOGANY buckshot chews into Quinn's si in pain. Another load catches him full in the face. He dr She falls to the floor --
The sound of RUSHING BLOOD pounding through her skull. Ev spinning. She struggles to move, turns her head, finds he eye with Curtis' corpse.
rising, his face torn up, smoking. WHIP PAN TO --
standing at the entrance to the morgue, a streetsweeper a in hand, sizing Quinn up.

Now don't we look dapper? Quinn BELLOWS with rage, ripping one of the heavy steel r doors from its hinges, flinging it at Blade like it was l furniture -- Blade rolls to the side as the door CRASHES against the w runs, moving through the morgue like a human tornado, hea windows at the end of the room -- SMASH!!! Out goes Quinn, taking half the wall with him. B to the decimated window, looks down --

Quinn lands on the roof of an ambulance parked four stori caving it in. He springs off, loping across the tarmac on limbs, then -SCREECH!-THWUMP!- rolling up onto the hood o oncoming car, before disappearing into the night --

Blade spins, SEES Karen bleeding her life away on the flo reaches a hand out to him, beseeching -- Blade pulls away from her grasp, takes a step towards the then hesitates.  A flicker of doubt washes across Blade's face. He looks d once more, wrestling with his conscience, finally making He kneels, scoops Karen up into his arms. Just then,
rush into the morgue, weapons drawn --

Hold it, ass-hole! Blade ignores them, turning to face the window before him good thirty feet to the roof of the adjacent building, a structure -- and damned if Blade doesn't seem to be consi jump. The Police close in, agitated. Blade crouches, switches K one-handed grip --
I said hold it!!! -- and jumps.

Blade clears the impossible distance -- almost. He snags the adjacent parking structure with his left hand even as from the grasp of his right -- -- a last-second save, his fingers clamping around her wr that stands between Karen and street pizza. She SCREAMS a dangling below him -- Blade GRUNTS, swinging Karen like a pendulum, heaving her the ledge as if she were a sack of potatoes. She lands on shoulder, clutching it in pain -- Blade heaves himself up, crouching beside her.
(gasping)

My shoulder -- dislocated -- Blade places a hand on her shoulder, another around her e without any consideration to discomfort -CRACK!- brutally back in place. Karen SCREAMS again as he scoops her up on heads for --
which is parked nearby. Midnight-black. The definitive hi performance heavy-metal muscle machine with an engine big power an Apollo rocket.
Blade sets Karen down in the passenger seat, climbs behin keys the ignition. The engine ROARS to life, belching fum the dual exhaust. Blade floors it, burning serious rubber vanishes from sight.

head_text.subj: BACK AT THE DEMOLISHED MORGUE WINDOW

text: as the two policemen stare numbly in open-mouthed astonis
Blade pilots the Olds down the streets, moving through a increasingly degenerating neighborhoods, coming at last t sprawling warehouse district.
The Olds approaches a mammoth industrial facility that's cordoned off by cyclone fencing and razor wire. Ultra-vio floodlights illuminate the area, while an army of securit keep a watchful eye.
Blade glances at Karen, cursing himself for giving into h He hits a remote secured to the sun visor --
A gate grinds open.  We follow the Olds as it cruises around the back of the b heading down a concrete loading ramp. At the bottom of th heavy iron door rises. Blade's Olds disappears into the d
More UV lights flicker on. We're in a massive loading ele HUMS as it ascends, eventually reaching its destination w BOOMING CLANG. The doors at the rear glide open. Blade gu Olds out.

Set up in an old ironworks, the place looks like a cross auto junkyard and an armory. Equipment is strewn everywhe lathes, mills, old furnaces, gutted vehicles, an ad hoc s theater -- all of it jerry-rigged in a brutal, oily-tech. Blade climbs out of the Olds. He opens the passenger door Karen out, carries her in his arms.
Whistler!

Are we bringing home strays now? ABRAHAM WHISTLER (60s) hobbles out of the shadows, leaning heavily on a cane. Gi bitter, his right leg encased in a metal brace. Though hi lined with wrinkles and his hair has long since gone gray he could kick the living shit out of any man half his age
She's been bitten.
You should've killed her, then.
She hasn't turned yet.  (pointedly)
You can help her. Blade and Whistler stare each other down. Finally, Whistl heads over to the operating theater.

No promises. You watch her close. She  starts to turn, you finish her off. Blade nods, lays Karen down on the operating table. Whist an overhead light. Karen is sheathed in sweat, ashen. She lot of blood. Whistler snaps on a pair of surgical gloves, probes the w Karen's neck with an antiseptic swab -- there's capillary around the perimeter of the wound, the tissue looks bruis gangrenous.
Localized necrosis. She's borderline.  Another hour and she'd be well into  the change. Whistler cracks open a smelling salt capsule and waves un nose. As she starts to stir --
Can you hear me, woman?  Karen's eyes open wide. She's scared, disoriented --
What -- ?

You've been bitten by a vampire. We've  got to try and burn out the venom,  just like a rattlesnake bite -- Whistler reaches for a massive syringe filled with causti fluid. Karen sees the syringe, resists --
Hold her.  Blade forces Karen back. Whistler readies the syringe.
(reading her name tag)

"Dr. Karen Jansen". Listen close, I'm  going to inject you with an antidote  made from allium setivum -- garlic.  This is going to hurt. A lot.  Whistler sinks the needle into Karen's neck and depresses plunger. "Hurt" doesn't begin to describe what Karen expe next. Imagine undergoing childbirth while someone pumps b through your veins. Karen SHRIEKS, her body going into uncontrolled paroxysms on her neck begins to smoke as the antidote attacks the p vampire venom. Karen clutches at Blade's arms, digging her nails in. She at him with unflinching intensity, like a child desperate for assurance.
uncomfortable playing the roll of nursemaid. He'd like no than to be done with this, but the only thing he can do i while she rides out the seizures.
growing darker by the moment. The last thing she sees is staring down at her -- then the night closes in.
CLOSE ON a monitor featuring footage taken at the vampire massacre. Blade turns and stares into the camera, fires h bow. The screen cuts to static.

moves into frame, holding a remote. With a tap of a butto monitor goes dark.  PULL BACK TO REVEAL a large, minimalist conference room - of Erebus, seat of the vampire race's legislative assembl Gathered around a massive table are the TWELVE VAMPIRE EL representing a "rainbow" of racial colors -- names like P VON ESPER, ASHE, BAVA. Two of them, the FAUSTINAS, are id twins -- lethal-looking women with alabaster skin.  Chilled carafes filled with blood are situated along the time to time, a member will pour themselves a glass, or p themselves to the bowls of human finger bones which serve At the head of the table is GAETANO DRAGONETTI, current v "Overlord". Blood-red eyes, parchment skin stretched over features. Incalculably ancient, but still deadly and viri viper.  Dragonetti speaks. He uses the "secret tongue" -- the anc language which utilizes consonants human vocal chords are of reproducing.
(subtitled)
Blade. Once again, our interests have  fallen victim to his ridiculous  crusade. He must be destroyed.
(in English)
You're wrong, Dragonetti.  All heads turn. Who would dare such impudence?

a mere "Underlord" in the vampire hierarchy, steps forwar Strikingly handsome, younger, less conservative than his fueled with a passionate intensity. Amongst the vampire c he's known as an agitator. He's also the vampire equivale racial supremacist.
The Day Walker represents a unique  opportunity. We'd be fools to waste  it by killing him.
(subtitled, taking umbrage)
Deacon Frost. You refuse to speak our  language, you insult the House of  Erebus by using the humans'  gutter-tongue, have you no respect  for tradition?
Why should I respect something which  has outlived its purpose? This causes quite a stir amongst the other vampires. Fros well have slapped Dragonetti in the face.
(simmering)
I see. And what would you have us do  with this "half-breed"?
Study him. Unlock the secrets of his  DNA. He's the key we've been looking  for.
He is an abomination!  Dragonetti slams his fist down, toppling a carafe, spilli across the tabletop. Frost looks to the others --

Why should we spend our lives  cringing from the daylight when his  blood offers us an alternative?  Enough talk. It's time we stepped out  of the shadows! Dragonetti looks apoplectic. ELDER PALLINTINE, a five-hun old vampire inhabiting the body of a prepubescent boy, in
You're out of line, Frost.
Am I? Or am I just the first to say  out loud what we've all been  thinking?  The fact that no one answers is telling. Dragonetti glowe other Elders, sensing the tide turning.
The shadows suit us, Frost. We've  existed this way for thousands of  years. Who are you to challenge our  ways?
Someone who's sick of living off  scraps. The coming age belongs to us,  not the humans!  (to the others)
When the final war between our races  comes, who do you want leading the  charge?  Frost stabs an accusing finger at the Overlord.
Some withered up fossil ready to snap  like a brittle bone at the first sign  of change? Dragonetti GROWLS like an beast, raking his claws across vampire's face, knocking him to the ground.
Get out!!! Frost picks himself up, touches the gashes on his cheek. fingers, licks the blood from them.
Careful, old fang. You might wake up  one day and find yourself extinct. Frost smiles at Dragonetti and calmly exits the room.

ON KAREN as she comes to. Her wounds have been bandaged. little shaky, takes in her surroundings -- She's in a spa like a monk's cell. On the wall is a collection of knives daggers. Some of them wooden, their hilts inscribed with looking runes. In the center of these weapons rests --

hanging like a cross in a chapel, dominating all else. Ka it. Then her eyes drop to a silver locket which dangles f by a tarnished chain. She reaches for it, opens it -- The locket features a photo, old and faded. It's the blac saw in the prologue, Vanessa, standing in the sunshine.  Karen moves towards the door, cautious --
We hear VOICES now, coming from beyond a series of black- curtains. Karen pushes one aside and SEES --
strapped into some kind of Inquisition-esque restraint ch shirt is off, his body slick with sweat. Whistler finishe Blade in, then stands back, holding up a gas-powered pist hesitant --
I had to increase the dose. You're  building up a resistance to the  serum --
(impatient)

Just do it, old man. Whistler nods, fitting Blade with a bite guard. Then he p pistol-injector against Blade's carotid artery.  Blade shakes violently, grinding his teeth through the bi veins cording in his neck. He clutches Whistler's hand, h tightly as he fights his way through the hellish seizure. credit, Whistler never lets go. Mentor and student stare at one another as the mysterious its violent course. We understand that these shared momen private in their horror, are the glue which binds the two hunters together. Finally, Blade slumps forward in his re exhausted.
She draws back, instinctively knowing that she's just wit something she shouldn't have. She looks for an exit, SEES doorway. She makes for it --
A dusty, darkened hole of a room, no windows, just shadow concrete, rust stains, and --

filled with swirling blood plasma, choked with electrical biomedical sensors. SOMETHING floats within, suspended in fluid -- a child , two or three years of age, drifting ab medical oddity preserved in formaldehyde --  THUMP! The child SLAMS up against the glass. Karen backpe startled. Its eyes are open now, pupils blown. It snarls, mouthful of razored fangs, trailing mouth-slime across th it futilely tries to chew its way through to Karen. Karen stifles a sob, turning and running right into --
who now blocks the exit, sword in hand. Karen retreats a wary --
You shouldn't be here.
I'm sorry, I --
Wandered off the beaten path, Doctor? Whistler has entered the room from a second doorway. Kare Whistler to Blade, trapped between them --
Who are you people?
My name is Abraham Whistler. (re: Blade)

This is Blade. As for our little  homunculus here -- Whistler limps over to the tank, rapping his cane against creature snaps at it reflexively, following the silver ti forth like a fish after a lure.
-- he's a vampire.
You're joking --

Not at all. You're looking at a prime  specimen of the homines nocturna.  Whistler toys with the feral creature, engaging in a cert of sadistic delight as its efforts grow increasingly more Suddenly, it surges towards the top of the tank, clawing lid -- Karen becomes alarmed -- but then a massive ELECTRICAL JO the creature back into submission.
If Blade hadn't brought you here, you  would've wound up like him. Karen brings a hand to her bandaged neck, recalling the e previous night. She looks to Blade.
Why did you help me? Blade scowls, his gaze flickering to Whistler.
Stupidity.
(appraising her)
Maybe not. I did some checking, she's  a hematologist. Knowledge like that  might come in handy.
It's not worth the risk. We can't  trust her.
Why?
Because you're tainted. The venom's  still inside you. You could still  turn on us.
What happens then? Blade looks to Whistler -- as far as he's concerned, the over.
Then I have to take you out, just  like any other bloodsucker. Blade turns and exits. Whistler and Karen follow.

Beyond the grimy outer windows, we can see that the day i long shadows, amber light. Karen lingers in the doorway, information overload.  Blade begins suiting up for his nightly hunt -- strapping armor, loading ammunition. He strings the tarnished locke neck as if it were an amulet that could ward off evil, th inspect a modified pistol, sighting down the length of it
We hunt them, moving from one city to  the next, tracking their migrations.  They're hard to kill. They tend to  regenerate. CLACK! Blade pulls the trigger on an empty chamber, then next weapon --
(sarcastic)
So what do you use, then? A stake?
(nodding)

Some of the old wives' tales are true  -- they're severely allergic to  silver, various types of wood. Feed  them garlic and they'll go into  anaphylactic shock --  Whistler picks up a customized rifle with a UV entry ligh on the beam.
-- and of course there's always  sunlight, ultra-violet rays.  Karen shakes her head, incredulous --
And you honestly expect me to believe  all this?

I don't care what you believe. I  saved your life once, I don't plan on  making a habit of it. You want my  advice, you'll be out of the city by  nightfall. If you're stupid enough to  stay, that's your business.
